sub_topic: Determining the type of bond between two atoms
message_1: What is the type of bond formed between a sodium ion and a chlorine ion in solid sodium chloride (NaCl)?
message_2: The type of bond formed between a sodium ion (Na+) and a chlorine ion (Cl-) in solid sodium chloride (NaCl) is an ionic bond. This bond is formed due to the electrostatic attraction between the positively charged sodium ion and the negatively charged chlorine ion.
